text: Urszula Kielan–Lipiec (born 10 October 1960 in Otwock) is a retired high jumper from Poland. She won four medals at the European Indoor Championships as well as an Olympic silver medal in 1980. ==Competition record== {| |- ! colspan="5" | Representing |- | 1978 | European Indoor Championships | Milan, Italy | style="background:#c96;" | 3rd | 1.88 m |- | 1979 | European Indoor Championships | Vienna, Austria | style="background:silver;" | 2nd | 1.85 m |- | rowspan=2 | 1980 | European Indoor Championships | Sindelfingen, West Germany | style="background:#c96;" | 3rd | 1.93 m |- | Olympic Games | Moscow, Soviet Union | style="background:silver;" | 2nd | 1.94 m |- | 1981 | European Indoor Championships | Grenoble, France | style="background:#c96;" | 3rd | 1.94 m |- | 1986 | European Indoor Championships | Madrid, Spain | 9th | 1.85 m |- | 1987 | World Indoor Championships | Indianapolis, United States | 11th | 1.85 m |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Polish female high jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1980 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Poland Category:People from Otwock Category:Sportspeople from Masovian Voivodeship Category:Olympic silver medalists for Poland Category:Olympic silver medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 1980 Summer Olympics
title: Urszula Kielan
